poem:
Title: Sparrows From Different Summers

Eastward wings carry graven messages,
cloak the sun with subtle passages.
Maneuvers of peace unfold in quiet verse,
over fields of contention, war's bitter curse.
Kuleba seeks a subcontinental ear,
India listens, intoning a thawing fear.
Under the same sun, different season's bloom,
yet both lands baffled by another's gloom.
